q: It's not how much money you make, it's how much money you keep.
h:
“It's not how much money you make, it's how much money you keep.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Enthusiasm makes up for a host of deficiencies.
h:
“Enthusiasm makes up for a host of deficiencies.” —
Barack Obama

q: Real loss is only possible when you love something more than you love yourself.
h:
“Real loss is only possible when you love something more than you love yourself.” —
Robin Williams

q: Everybody's life is either rewarding or an example.
h:
“Everybody's life is either rewarding or an example.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
h:
“Creativity is intelligence having fun.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.
h:
“Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.” —
Helen Keller

q: Rest and be kind, you don't have to prove anything.
h:
“Rest and be kind, you don't have to prove anything.” —
Jack Kerouac

q: To think is easy. To act is hard. But the hardest thing in the world is to act in accordance with your thinking.
h:
“To think is easy. To act is hard. But the hardest thing in the world is to act in accordance with your thinking.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
h:
“Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love. ” —
Lao Tzu

q: It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.
h:
“It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: Never feel shame for trying and failing, for he who has never failed is he who has never tried.
h:
“Never feel shame for trying and failing, for he who has never failed is he who has never tried.” —
Og Mandino

q: Those who are easily shocked should be shocked more often.
h:
“Those who are easily shocked should be shocked more often.” —
Mae West

q: It is secondary whether we choose belief or defiance. What is precious is that we are always able to choose.
h:
“It is secondary whether we choose belief or defiance. What is precious is that we are always able to choose.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
h:
“In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: When it comes to mastering a skill, time is the magic ingredient.
h:
“When it comes to mastering a skill, time is the magic ingredient.” —
Robert Greene

q: The goal is not to be perfect by the end, the goal is to be better today.
h:
“The goal is not to be perfect by the end, the goal is to be better today.” —
Simon Sinek

q: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
h:
“The energy of the mind is the essence of life.” —
Aristotle

q: To lead an orchestra, you must turn your back on the crowd.
h:
“To lead an orchestra, you must turn your back on the crowd.” —
Aristotle

q: Don't live the same year 75 times and call it a life.
h:
“Don't live the same year 75 times and call it a life.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.
h:
“Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Success is not to be pursued, it is to be attracted by the person you become.
h:
“Success is not to be pursued, it is to be attracted by the person you become.” —
Jim Rohn

q: The truth is simple. If it was complicated, everyone would understand it.
h:
“The truth is simple. If it was complicated, everyone would understand it.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Not all those who wander are lost.
h:
“Not all those who wander are lost.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.
h:
“Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.” —
Joan Rivers

q: Never be bored, and you will never be boring.
h:
“Never be bored, and you will never be boring.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: The most important thing is to enjoy your life, to be happy, it's all that matters.
h:
“The most important thing is to enjoy your life, to be happy, it's all that matters.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: We ourselves feel that what we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But the ocean would be less because of that missing drop.
h:
“We ourselves feel that what we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But the ocean would be less because of that missing drop.” —
Mother Teresa

q: The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost.
h:
“The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
h:
“Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
h:
“It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.” —
Herman Melville

q: The best of us sometimes eat our words.
h:
“The best of us sometimes eat our words. ” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: Any thought that is passed on to the subconscious often enough and convincingly enough is finally accepted.
h:
“Any thought that is passed on to the subconscious often enough and convincingly enough is finally accepted.” —
Robert Collier

q: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
h:
“Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.” —
Mark Twain

q: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life.
h:
“Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life.” —
Steve Jobs

q: We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.
h:
“We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: If you done it, it ain't bragging.
h:
“If you done it, it ain't bragging.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.
h:
“Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.” —
Bob Dylan

q: Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.
h:
“Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.” —
John Wooden

q: You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.
h:
“You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.” —
Stephen King

q: Simplicity is a difficult thing to achieve.
h:
“Simplicity is a difficult thing to achieve. ” —
Charlie Chaplin

q: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is enlightenment.
h:
“Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is enlightenment.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Showing off is the fool's idea of glory.
h:
“Showing off is the fool's idea of glory. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: None but ourselves can free our minds.
h:
“None but ourselves can free our minds.” —
Bob Marley

q: Wit is educated insolence.
h:
“Wit is educated insolence.” —
Aristotle

q: Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.
h:
“Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.” —
James Cameron

q: It's better to dance than to march through life.
h:
“It's better to dance than to march through life.” —
Yoko Ono

q: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
h:
“Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.” —
Carl Jung

q: Just throw away all thoughts of imaginary things, and stand firm in that which you are.
h:
“Just throw away all thoughts of imaginary things, and stand firm in that which you are.” —
Kabir

q: Watch what you say, and whaterver you say, practice it.
h:
“Watch what you say, and whaterver you say, practice it.” —
Soyen Shaku

q: The more knowledge you have, the more you're free to rely on your instincts.
h:
“The more knowledge you have, the more you're free to rely on your instincts.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger
